answer_box.title: How Do Solar Panels Work? Step by Step Guide | EnergySage
answer_box.snippet: Solar panels work by absorbing sunlight with photovoltaic cells, generating direct current (DC) energy and then converting it to usable alternating current (AC) energy with the help of inverter technology. AC energy then flows through the home's electrical panel and is distributed accordingly.

organic_results.title: What is Solar Energy and How Do Solar Panels Work ...
organic_results.snippet: Solar energy works by capturing the sun's energy and turning it into electricity for your home or business. Our sun is a natural nuclear reactor. It releases tiny packets of energy called photons, which travel the 93 million miles from the sun to Earth in about 8.5 minutes.

organic_results.title: How Does Solar Power Work, Anyway? | Climate Reality
organic_results.snippet: A solar panel “works by allowing photons, or particles of light, to knock electrons free from atoms, generating a flow of electricity,” according to Live Science.
